summary: This is an email chain from May 2020 discussing operational coordination regarding an investigation, specifically mentioning giving a heads up about opening something, concerns about Mark Epstein announcing himself as a victim, and connecting an individual named Hagan for a threats investigation.

persons.name: Laura
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who should be given a heads up about opening an investigation.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who should potentially be given a heads up about opening an investigation.

persons.name: Mark
persons.context: Referenced as someone who might go out and announce he's a victim, which the sender believes would not be well received.

persons.name: Hagan
persons.context: Described as being 'on board for the threats investigation' and needing to be connected with an agent and defense counsel.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the subject about whom background information should be provided in relation to the investigation.

connections.description: The email references 'Mark' and 'Mark Epstein' in close context, suggesting they are the same individual being discussed as a potential victim.
Hagan is brought on for a threats investigation, and background on Mark Epstein is to be provided to him and others.

events.title: Coordination for threats investigation
events.description: An email indicates Hagan is on board for a threats investigation and needs to be connected with an agent and defense counsel, with background on Mark Epstein provided.

events.title: Discussion of opening investigation and victim announcement
events.description: Email discusses giving a heads up about opening an investigation and expresses concern that Mark might announce himself as a victim, which would not be well received.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email chain from late May 2020 discussing operational aspects of an investigation.
It references a 'threats investigation' for which an individual named Hagan is brought on board.
Mark Epstein is a subject of the discussion, with background information about him to be provided to investigators.
There is expressed concern that if 'Mark' (likely Mark Epstein) publicly announces he is a victim, it 'will not be well received.'
The correspondence shows coordination between parties about managing the public and investigative aspects of a case involving Mark Epstein.
